newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran police seize 1.4 tonnes of opium.
newsitem.headline: Iran police seize 1.4 tonnes of opium.

text.p: Police in northeastern Iran seized almost 1.4 tonnes of opium after a deadly gunbattle with traffickers, a Tehran newspaper said on Wednesday.

The daily Kayhan quoted a security official in Khorasan province as saying police hauled 1,367 kg (3,010 lb) of opium and a variety of weapons after the shootout in which one smuggler was killed. It did not say when the clash occured.

According to Iranian law, possession of five kg (11 lb) of opium or 30 grams of heroin is punishable by death. More than 1,000 people have been executed in drug-related cases since the law took effect in 1989.
Iran is a major transit route for drugs, mostly opium from which heroin is made, being smuggled to Europe via Turkey from Afghanistan and Pakistan.
